alert.note: Alert for Gogebic (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Excessive spring snow melt is resulting in river rises along the Montreal River. This has resulted in some river flooding and road closures. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Upper Michigan, including the following county, Gogebic. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Roads are closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported snowmelt in the warned area due to snowmelt. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ironwood. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
